definitions.definition: to put right a wrong or give payment for a wrong that has been done:
examples: Most managers, politicians and bosses are men - how can women redress the balance (= make the situation fairer and more equal)?

definitions.definition: money that you have to pay to someone else because you have injured that person or treated them badly:
examples: He went to the industrial tribunal to seek redress for the way his employers had discriminated against him.
